questions.question_text: Find the common factors of the given terms. (i) 12x, 36 (ii) 2y, 22xy (iii) 14 pq, 28p2q2 (iv) 2x, 3x2, 4 (v) 6 abc, 24ab2, 12 a2b (vi) 16 x3, – 4x2, 32x (vii) 10 pq, 20qr, 30rp (viii) 3x2 y3, 10x3 y2, 6 x2 y2 z
hints: Write each term as a product of irreducible factors
Identify factors that appear in all terms

questions.question_text: Factorise the following expressions. (i) 7x – 42 (ii) 6p – 12q (iii) 7a2 + 14a (iv) – 16 z + 20 z3 (v) 20 l2 m + 30 a l m (vi) 5 x2 y – 15 xy2 (vii) 10 a2 – 15 b2 + 20 c2 (viii) – 4 a2 + 4 ab – 4 ca (ix) x2 y z + x y2z + x y z2 (x) a x2 y + b x y2 + c x y z
hints: Find the common factor in all terms
Use distributive law to factor out the common factor

questions.question_text: Factorise. (i) x2 + x y + 8x + 8y (ii) 15 xy – 6x + 5y – 2 (iii) ax + bx – ay – by (iv) 15 pq + 15 + 9q + 25p (v) z – 7 + 7 x y – x y z
hints: Group terms with common factors
Factorise each group separately
Look for a common binomial factor

questions.question_text: Factorise the following expressions. (i) a2 + 8a + 16 (ii) p2 – 10 p + 25 (iii) 25m2 + 30m + 9 (iv) 49y2 + 84yz + 36z2 (v) 4x2 – 8x + 4 (vi) 121b2 – 88bc + 16c2 (vii) (l + m)2 – 4lm (Hint: Expand ( l + m)2 first) (viii) a4 + 2a2b2 + b4
hints: Check if the expression is a perfect square trinomial
Use identities: (a + b)² = a² + 2ab + b² or (a - b)² = a² - 2ab + b²
Look for difference of squares: a² - b² = (a + b)(a - b)
Factor out common factors first if needed
Rearrange terms to apply identities

questions.question_text: Factorise the expressions. (i) ax2 + bx (ii) 7p2 + 21q2 (iii) 2x3 + 2xy2 + 2xz2 (iv) am2 + bm2 + bn2 + an2 (v) (lm + l) + m + 1 (vi) y (y + z) + 9 (y + z) (vii) 5y2 – 20y – 8z + 2yz (viii) 10ab + 4a + 5b + 2 (ix) 6xy – 4y + 6 – 9x
hints: Look for common factors
Use grouping method for four-term expressions
Rearrange terms if necessary

questions.question_text: Factorise. (i) a4 – b4 (ii) p4 – 81 (iii) x4 – (y + z)4 (iv) x4 – (x – z)4 (v) a4 – 2a2b2 + b4
hints: Treat as difference of squares: a⁴ - b⁴ = (a²)² - (b²)²
Apply identity multiple times if needed
For (v), recognize it as (a² - b²)²

questions.question_text: Factorise the following expressions. (i) p2 + 6p + 8 (ii) q2 – 10q + 21 (iii) p2 + 6p – 16
hints: Find two numbers that multiply to constant term and add to coefficient of middle term
Use identity: x² + (a+b)x + ab = (x+a)(x+b)
Write numerator and denominator in irreducible factor form
Cancel common factors

questions.question_text: Divide the given polynomial by the given monomial. (i) (5x2 – 6x) ÷ 3x (ii) (3y8 – 4y6 + 5y4) ÷ y4 (iii) 8(x3y2z2 + x2y3z2 + x2y2z3) ÷ 4x2y2z2 (iv) (x3 + 2x2 + 3x) ÷ 2x (v) (p3q6 – p6q3) ÷ p3q3
hints: Divide each term of polynomial by the monomial
Alternatively, factor out common factor and cancel
Factorise numerator and denominator completely
Cancel common factors
Cancel common factors directly
No need to expand expressions

questions.question_text: Factorise the expressions and divide them as directed. (i) (y2 + 7y + 10) ÷ (y + 5) (ii) (m2 – 14m – 32) ÷ (m + 2) (iii) (5p2 – 25p + 20) ÷ (p – 1) (iv) 4yz(z2 + 6z – 16) ÷ 2y(z + 8) (v) 5pq(p2 – q2) ÷ 2p(p + q) (vi) 12xy(9x2 – 16y2) ÷ 4xy(3x + 4y) (vii) 39y3(50y2 – 98) ÷ 26y2(5y + 7)
hints: Factorise numerator completely first
Cancel common factors with denominator
Use identities like a² - b² = (a+b)(a-b)
